boardgame.name: Kahuna
カフナの島々
카후나
boardgame.description: Originally published in 1997 as Arabana-Ikibiti by the designer's own publisher Bambus Spieleverlag, then reprinted by Funagain in the U.S., Kosmos' Kahuna _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;ndash; part of its Kosmos two-player series _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;ndash; is the best known implementation of this design._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;It's a two-player game, played on a board depicting twelve islands. Players use cards to place bridges between these islands or remove opponent's bridges. If you get the majority of bridges around an island, you place one of your marker stones on it and also remove any of your opponent's bridges to that island _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;ndash; which might cause them to lose a bridge majority on an adjacent island and lose a marker stone there._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;The game is played in three rounds. A round ends when all cards from the face down deck and the three face up cards have been taken. Then points are scored for the islands with a marker stone on them. The game can also end sooner when one player has absolutely NO bridges left on the board._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;The Kosmos edition has excellent graphics and nice wooden pieces and plays very well._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Reimplements:_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; Arabana-Ikibiti_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Reimplemented by:_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; Kanaloa_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;

Rio Grande Version (RIO 118) Number of players: 2 Age of players: 10+ Length: 30 minutes Players use cards to build bridges between islands. When a player dominates an island with bridges, he controls the island. Their are three rounds with scoring after each - the total score wins this fast and fun 2 player game! Author: Günnter Cornett

Selling the Rio Grande Games version of Kahuna. The game has been played three to four times. I have tried to keep the game in good shape after all of these years. All game components are inventoried and present (50 Kahuna bridges, 20 Kahuna stones, 24 cards, rules and game board). Game board is still in pretty decent shape after all of these years. As this game was one of my first purchases, the box shows wear and tear, especially on the front cover. Nothing bad, but you can tell the box has been worn. Game insert is still present and still in pretty good shape. Game comes from a non-smoking house.
Condition as photos - Note the wear and tears As you can see heavily played and worn but its time to move on £3.00 Postage and Packaging to UK

KOSMOS (THK691806) Who will rule the South Seas? Two Kahuna compete for dominance on an archipelago consisting of twelve small islands. Using their magic and wisdom, they struggle for control of the islands. They anxiously await the cards handed to them by fate. But when the time is right, they move to capture one, two, or even more islands, trying to gain the upper hand. At the mercy of the magical powers of the South Seas, they quickly realize that even the best magic is no good without strategy.
